intro: Thesium microcarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruited thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its compact, succulent appearance with fleshy, strap-like leaves arranged in a rosette. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Thesium microcarpum is adapted to withstand drought, with thick leaves that store water and reduce transpiration.
